STREET-01.name: Street

enterText.first: You are on the street. The walkway to Mrs. McGillicutty's house is to the north. The sidewalk continues to the east. [hint: type go north (or just north) to go to the house, east to keep walking.]
enterText.repeat: You are on the street. The path to Mrs. McGillicutty's house is to the north. The sidewalk continues to the east.

STREET-01.lookText: You are on the street. The path to Mrs. McGillicutty's house is to the north. The sidewalk continues to the east. [Hint: type 'go north' to revisit Mrs. McGillicutty's house, or 'go east' to head on down the road.]

STREET-02.name: Street

enterText.first: You walk down the street to the Radley House. Such an imposing decrepit old house! Sort of a cross between the Addams Family mansion and Notre Dame Cathedral. Gothic! To the north is the front porch. or... maybe you should just walk west back to Mrs. McGillicutty's house?
enterText.repeat: You are in front of the Radley House again. Its not so bad once you get used to it.... if you're a ghost!

STREET-02.lookText: You are in front of the Radley House again. Its not so bad once you get used to it I guess.

NICE-PORCH.name: Nice Porch

enterText.first: You are standing on Mrs. McGillicutty's porch. The porch light is on, casting a warm welcoming glow. [hint: type ring doorbell or use doorbell to ring the doorbell.]
enterText.second: The porch light is off, but you try the bell anyway. No one answers.
enterText.repeat: The porch light is off. No one answers the door.

NICE-PORCH.lookText: You are on Mrs. McGillicutty's porch. The front door is north and the pathway to the street is south.

NICE-HOUSE.name: Nice House

enterText.first: NOTE THIS IS NOW IN THE ITEMS - THIS IS LEFT HERE TO REMIND ME. The door to the nice house swings open. Mrs. McGillicutty answers. Her face is painted green, and she is wearing a pointy witch hat. 'Elphaba!' you think? She holds a small candy dish, and tells you to take two candies. After you take the candies she leans over and whispers 'Mr. Radley and his son Aurhur next door are having a scavenger hunt. You might find this note useful during that game!' She hands you a handwritten note and you put it in your pocket. [hint: type examine list to read Mrs. McGillicutty's clues.] 'Good luck dear!' she says, and closes the door.
enterText.second: The porchlight is off. You ring and ring, but no one answers.
enterText.repeat: The porchlight is off. You ring and ring, but no one answers.

NICE-HOUSE.lookText: You are still on the porch.

FRONT-PORCH.name: Front Porch

enterText.first: You go up the walkway to the front porch of the Radley House. The porchlight is flickering. Not a soul in sight. There is a brass door gong handle to the right of the door. [hint: type use gong or turn handle to sound the gong!.]
enterText.repeat: You are on the Radley's front porch. Porchlight still flickering and buzzing. The gong handle is very ornate. What!! Is that a rat?

FRONT-PORCH.lookText: You are on the Radley's front porch. The door gong handle is right in front of you. Dark. Dank. And spooky. Entry into the house is to the north. The sidewalk is behind you to the south.

FOYER.name: Foyer

enterText.first: You enter the Radley House FOYER. It reminds you of a scene from that Downton Abbey show... there are doors everywhere! [hint: type take or get to pick up items you find.]

FOYER.lookText: You are in the FOYER.  Doors lead all directions!

enterText.first: You enter the LIBRARY. Wow! Tall bookshelves line the walls, and the floor is covered in a thick carpet. There are several armchairs scattered around the room. An open book lies on a table near the window. [hint: you can examine items you find here.]

enterText.repeat: You are in the DINING ROOM.

DINING-ROOM.lookText: You are in the DINING ROOM.

enterText.first: You enter the STUDY. [hint: try to examine things you see in rooms.]

MUSIC-ROOM.name: Music Room

enterText.first: You enter the MUSIC ROOM. [hint: don't forget to look around to see what's in each room.]
enterText.repeat: You are in the MUSIC ROOM.

TV-ROOM.name: TV Room

enterText.first: You enter the TV ROOM. A large flat-screen TV mounted on the wall is playing a movie - the classic 1938 screwball comedy 'Bringing Up Baby.' On the screen, Cary Grant and Katharine Hepburn are in the middle of a hilarious scene involving a leopard. Against the opposite wall stands an elegant wooden cabinet with glass doors. Through the glass, you can see shelves lined with DVD cases. Your eyes are drawn to a DVD of 'Bringing Up Baby' on the second shelf. Wait... how is the movie playing if the DVD is right there in the cabinet? [hint: you could try to open cabinet.]
enterText.repeat: You are in the TV ROOM. The movie is still playing on the TV, and the DVD cabinet stands against the wall.

TV-ROOM.lookText: You are in the TV ROOM. A large TV is mounted on one wall, currently playing 'Bringing Up Baby.' An elegant DVD cabinet with glass doors stands against the opposite wall.

HOME.name: Home

enterText.first: You walk home. It's great to be able to rest after all that trick-or-treating.  You pour all your candy out on the dining room table.  What a great haul!  .........  That's about it for this game.  Nothing more to do here.  You might as well choose another mini-game and go have some fun!
enterText.repeat: You are home.  The game is over.  Choose another mini-game.

HOME.lookText: You are home.  The game is over.  Choose another mini-game.
